wfBgpDelete.name: wfBgpDelete
wfBgpDelete.description: Create/Delete parameter for determining whether or not BGP is configured on this router.

wfBgpDisable.name: wfBgpDisable
wfBgpDisable.description: Enable/Disable parameter for determining whether or not to allow any versions of BGP to start up.

wfBgpIdentifier.name: wfBgpIdentifier
wfBgpIdentifier.description: The BGP Identifier for this router.

wfBgpLocalAs.name: wfBgpLocalAs
wfBgpLocalAs.description: The Autonomous System (AS) that this router belongs to.

wfBgpEbgpDebugSwitch.name: wfBgpEbgpDebugSwitch
wfBgpEbgpDebugSwitch.description: If this debug switch is enabled, BGP will not enforce the rule that requires each EBGP peer to be on a directly attached network.

wfBgpVersion.name: wfBgpVersion
wfBgpVersion.description: Vector of supported BGP protocol version numbers. Each peer negotiates the version from this vector. Versions are identified via the string of bits contained within this attribute. The first octet contains bits 0 to 7, the second octet contains bits 8 to 15, and so on, with the most significant bit referring to the lowest bit number in the octet (e.g., the MSB of the first octet refers to bit 0). If a bit, i, is present and set, then the version (i+1) of the BGP is supported.

wfBgpIntraAsIbgpRouting.name: wfBgpIntraAsIbgpRouting
wfBgpIntraAsIbgpRouting.description: If this switch is enabled, BGP will perform Intra-AS IBGP routing.

wfIbgpFromProtocols.name: wfIbgpFromProtocols
wfIbgpFromProtocols.description: if Intra-AS IBGP routing is enabled, this attribute spcifies if non-BGP external routes can be propogated via IBGP.

wfBgpIntAdvTimer.name: wfBgpIntAdvTimer
wfBgpIntAdvTimer.description: the minimum time interval, in seconds, between injections of EBGP routes into the IP routing table. default is 5. Can't be zero

wfBgpUsedRoutes.name: wfBgpUsedRoutes
wfBgpUsedRoutes.description: the number of received BGP routes that have been submitted for possible inclusion in the IP routing table.

wfBgpTotalRoutes.name: wfBgpTotalRoutes
wfBgpTotalRoutes.description: the total number of BGP routes currently maintained.

wfBgpTotalPaths.name: wfBgpTotalPaths
wfBgpTotalPaths.description: the total number of BGP path attributes blocks currently maintained.

wfBgpMaxRedundantIbgpRoutes.name: wfBgpMaxRedundantIbgpRoutes
wfBgpMaxRedundantIbgpRoutes.description: Specifies the maximum number of IBGP routes to the same destination to be stored. At this point at least one route is stored even if zero is specified. If set to BGP_MAX_REDUNDANT_RTS_MAXIMUM, no limit will be imposed.

wfBgpRouteRequestSwitch.name: wfBgpRouteRequestSwitch
wfBgpRouteRequestSwitch.description: If this switch is enabled and at least one connection to IBGP route server is enabled, alternate routes to a destination which became unreachable will be requested from the Route Server.

wfBgpConnCollisionDetect.name: wfBgpConnCollisionDetect
wfBgpConnCollisionDetect.description: If this switch is enabled, redundant BGP connections to the same router will be detected and disallowed, i.e. only one BGP connection to the same router will be maintained.

wfBgpRsTopology.name: wfBgpRsTopology
wfBgpRsTopology.description: Specifies IBGP Route Server connection topology: none(Non-RS), RC, full-mesh, or tree. To enable Route Server mode full-mesh or tree topology must be selected.

wfBgpClusterIdentifier.name: wfBgpClusterIdentifier
wfBgpClusterIdentifier.description: If RS Server, cluster Identifer for this server

wfBgpDynamicPolChangeSupport.name: wfBgpDynamicPolChangeSupport
wfBgpDynamicPolChangeSupport.description: If this switch is enabled, when a BGP policy rule changes all affected routes are dynamically re-evaluated according to the new policy specification. If this switch is disabled, all bgp connections are restarted.

wfBgpSoloistSlots.name: wfBgpSoloistSlots
wfBgpSoloistSlots.description: Slot mask for which slots BGP is eligible to run on. The MSBit represents slot 1, the next most significant bit represents slot 2, and so on... Slots can be 1-14. Default is all slots on a BCN.

wfBgpSoloistSlot.name: wfBgpSoloistSlot
wfBgpSoloistSlot.description: Slot on which BGP runs in Soloist mode. Slots can be 1-14. Zero means that BGP is not in a Soloist mode. Default is zero.

wfBgpSubnetAggregation.name: wfBgpSubnetAggregation
wfBgpSubnetAggregation.description: If this switch is enabled, non-BGP originated subnet routes are aggregated to their corresponding natural network routes for advertisement to bgp peers. Advertisement of BGP originated routes is not affected by this switch.

wfBgpBlackHoleSupport.name: wfBgpBlackHoleSupport
wfBgpBlackHoleSupport.description: If this switch is disabled BGP doesn't submit a 'black-hole' route into IP routing table for an aggregate route advertised to a BGP peer. For action 'drop' packet will be dropped and for 'reject' - 'ICMP Destination Unreachable' will be send back.

wfBgpMedComparison.name: wfBgpMedComparison
wfBgpMedComparison.description: If this switch is disabled BGP, the Multi-Exit Discriminator (MED) route attribute is not considered in the route selection process.

wfBgpIbgpReflection.name: wfBgpIbgpReflection
wfBgpIbgpReflection.description: Enables/Disables reflecting of BGP routes to IBGP peers.

wfBgpIbgpEcmpMethod.name: wfBgpIbgpEcmpMethod
wfBgpIbgpEcmpMethod.description: Method to use IGP ECMP routing information for an IBGP peering. route-balance method distributes a set of destination networks that share the same IBGP Next Hop among available ECMP routes. Each IBGP network has one route submitted to IP RTM. traffic-balance uses all avaiable IGP ECMP routes. Each IBGP network submitted to IP RTM number of times equal to number IGP ECMP routes to IBGP Next Hop.

wfBgpConfedIdentifier.name: wfBgpConfedIdentifier
wfBgpConfedIdentifier.description: The BGP Confederation Identifier for this router. NIL means this AS is not a member of any confederation

wfBgpConfedPeers.name: wfBgpConfedPeers
wfBgpConfedPeers.description: Peer list of this BGP speaker to other member sub_ASs within the same confederation, NIL means no peer from this speaker to neighbor ASs that are members of this local confederation

wfBgpIgpInterAction.name: wfBgpIgpInterAction
wfBgpIgpInterAction.description: Bit map for BGP/IGP interaction control: bit 15 bit 0 +---------------------------------------+ | | +---------------------------------------+ bit0: eBGP to OSPF bit1: eBGP to RIP bit2 - bit15: Reserved value 0 means no interaction

wfBgp3Delete.name: wfBgp3Delete
wfBgp3Delete.description: Create/Delete parameter for determining whether or not BGP3 is configured on this router.

wfBgp3Disable.name: wfBgp3Disable
wfBgp3Disable.description: Enable/Disable parameter for determining whether or not to start-up BGP3.

wfBgp3IntraAsIbgpRouting.name: wfBgp3IntraAsIbgpRouting
wfBgp3IntraAsIbgpRouting.description: If this switch is enabled, BGP-3 will perform Intra-AS IBGP routing.

wfBgp3IntAdvTimer.name: wfBgp3IntAdvTimer
wfBgp3IntAdvTimer.description: the minimum time interval, in seconds, between injections of EBGP routes into the IP routing table. default is 5. can't be zero

wfBgp3RipRules.name: wfBgp3RipRules
wfBgp3RipRules.description: if enabled, IBGP routes that are also reachable via a RIP route will be consider 'reachable' and will be used. the use of this is highly discouraged.

wfBgp3UsedRoutes.name: wfBgp3UsedRoutes
wfBgp3UsedRoutes.description: the number of received BGP-3 routes that have been submitted for possible inclusion in the IP routing table.

wfBgp3TotalRoutes.name: wfBgp3TotalRoutes
wfBgp3TotalRoutes.description: the total number of BGP-3 routes currently maintained.

wfBgp4Delete.name: wfBgp4Delete
wfBgp4Delete.description: Create/Delete parameter for determining whether or not BGP-4 is configured on this router.

wfBgp4Disable.name: wfBgp4Disable
wfBgp4Disable.description: Enable/Disable parameter for determining whether or not to start-up BGP-4.

wfBgpPeerTable.name: wfBgpPeerTable
wfBgpPeerTable.description: The BGP Peer table contains configuration and statistical information regarding this router's BGP peers

wfBgpPeerEntry.name: wfBgpPeerEntry
wfBgpPeerEntry.description: An entry in the BGP-Peer table

wfBgpPeerDelete.name: wfBgpPeerDelete
wfBgpPeerDelete.description: Create/Delete: if set to delete, the peer connection is removed

wfBgpPeerDisable.name: wfBgpPeerDisable
wfBgpPeerDisable.description: Enable/Disable: controls whether the peer connection is enabled or disabled

wfBgpPeerState.name: wfBgpPeerState
wfBgpPeerState.description: the administrative state of the peer connection on this interface

wfBgpPeerMinVersion.name: wfBgpPeerMinVersion
wfBgpPeerMinVersion.description: the minimum BGP version number supported on this connection. Default is 4.

wfBgpPeerMaxVersion.name: wfBgpPeerMaxVersion
wfBgpPeerMaxVersion.description: the maximum BGP version number supported on this connection Default is 4.

wfBgpPeerRemoteAs.name: wfBgpPeerRemoteAs
wfBgpPeerRemoteAs.description: the configured peer's AS number. this must be filled in. the AS received in the open message must match this one.

wfBgpPeerExtAdvTimer.name: wfBgpPeerExtAdvTimer
wfBgpPeerExtAdvTimer.description: Time interval in seconds for the MinRouteAdvertisementInterval BGP timer. Default is 30. Can't be zero

wfBgpPeerConnectRetry.name: wfBgpPeerConnectRetry
wfBgpPeerConnectRetry.description: the ConnectRetry timer, in seconds. this is the time between TCP connection attempts.

wfBgpPeerCfgHoldtime.name: wfBgpPeerCfgHoldtime
wfBgpPeerCfgHoldtime.description: the configured Holdtime timer, in seconds. this is the maximum time that the peer can wait without receiving a KEEPALIVE from this speaker. if no hold timer is to be used (for an SVC), zero should be entered. otherwise, the value must be 3 or greater. this value is sent in the OPEN message. upon receipt of an OPEN, the received hold time is compared to this value. if both are zero, no hold timer will be run and periodic keepalives will not be sent. otherwise, the minimum of the two timers will be used. if this results in a hold timer of less than 3, 3 will be used.

wfBgpPeerHoldtime.name: wfBgpPeerHoldtime
wfBgpPeerHoldtime.description: the Holdtime timer value that was negotiated and is in use

wfBgpPeerCfgKeepAlive.name: wfBgpPeerCfgKeepAlive
wfBgpPeerCfgKeepAlive.description: the configured KeepAlive timer, in seconds. this is the interval between sending KEEPALIVE messages. if the hold timer was set to zero, this is ignored. otherwise, the KeepAlive timer will be set to the minimum of this value and 1/3 of the hold timer.

wfBgpPeerKeepAlive.name: wfBgpPeerKeepAlive
wfBgpPeerKeepAlive.description: the value used for the KeepAlive timer

wfBgpPeerPathAttrSwitch.name: wfBgpPeerPathAttrSwitch
wfBgpPeerPathAttrSwitch.description: controls whether the wfBgp3PathAttrTable (and the bgpRcvdPathAttrTable) will be maintained.

wfBgpPeerIdentifier.name: wfBgpPeerIdentifier
wfBgpPeerIdentifier.description: the BGP ID of the Peer

wfBgpPeerConnState.name: wfBgpPeerConnState
wfBgpPeerConnState.description: the state of the BGP connection FSM

wfBgpPeerNegotiatedVersion.name: wfBgpPeerNegotiatedVersion
wfBgpPeerNegotiatedVersion.description: the negotiated version of BGP running between the two peers

wfBgpPeerInUpdates.name: wfBgpPeerInUpdates
wfBgpPeerInUpdates.description: the number of BGP UPDATE messages received on this connection. This object should be initialized to zero when the connection is established.

wfBgpPeerOutUpdates.name: wfBgpPeerOutUpdates
wfBgpPeerOutUpdates.description: the number of BGP UPDATE messages transmitted on this connection. This object should be initialized to zero when the connection is established.

wfBgpPeerInTotalMessages.name: wfBgpPeerInTotalMessages
wfBgpPeerInTotalMessages.description: the total number of messages received from the remote peer on this connection. This object should be initialized to zero when the connection is established.

wfBgpPeerOutTotalMessages.name: wfBgpPeerOutTotalMessages
wfBgpPeerOutTotalMessages.description: the total number of messages transmitted from the remote peer on this connection. This object should be initialized to zero when the connection is established.

wfBgpPeerLastError.name: wfBgpPeerLastError
wfBgpPeerLastError.description: the last error code and subcode seen by this peer on this connection. If no error has occurred, this field is zero. Otherwise, the first byte of this two byte OCTET STRING contains the error code; the second contains the subcode.

wfBgpPeerTotalRoutes.name: wfBgpPeerTotalRoutes
wfBgpPeerTotalRoutes.description: the total number of routes that were received from this peer that we are currently maintaining.

wfBgpPeerFsmEstablishedTransitions.name: wfBgpPeerFsmEstablishedTransitions
wfBgpPeerFsmEstablishedTransitions.description: The total number of times the BGP FSM transitioned into the established state.

wfBgpPeerFsmEstablishedTime.name: wfBgpPeerFsmEstablishedTime
wfBgpPeerFsmEstablishedTime.description: This timer indicates how long (in seconds) this peer has been in the Established state or how long since this peer was last in the Established state. It is set to zero when a new peer is configured or the router is booted.

wfBgpPeerInUpdateElapsedTime.name: wfBgpPeerInUpdateElapsedTime
wfBgpPeerInUpdateElapsedTime.description: Elapsed time in seconds since the last BGP UPDATE message was received from the peer. Each time wfBgpPeerInUpdates is incremented, the value of this object is set to zero (0).

wfBgpPeerMinASOriginationInterval.name: wfBgpPeerMinASOriginationInterval
wfBgpPeerMinASOriginationInterval.description: Time interval in seconds for the MinASOriginationInterval timer. The default value for this timer is 15 seconds. Can't be zero.

wfBgpPeerLocalAS.name: wfBgpPeerLocalAS
wfBgpPeerLocalAS.description: If configured, specifies the AS Number that is sent in OPEN message to this peer. If zero, the AS Number specified with wfBgpLocalAS attribute is used.

wfBgpPeerMaxUpdateSize.name: wfBgpPeerMaxUpdateSize
wfBgpPeerMaxUpdateSize.description: Specifies the maximum size (in bytes) of UPDATE message that can be sent to this peer. Note that, if the message size that is needed to advertise a single route is greater than the configured maximum message size, the acctual message size can exceed the configured value.

wfBgpPeerRouteEchoSwitch.name: wfBgpPeerRouteEchoSwitch
wfBgpPeerRouteEchoSwitch.description: The switch controls route echoing. If enabled, a BGP route that is selected for forwarding is advertised back to the peer from which the route was received.

wfBgpPeerDiscardDuplicateRouteSwitch.name: wfBgpPeerDiscardDuplicateRouteSwitch
wfBgpPeerDiscardDuplicateRouteSwitch.description: Indicates if duplicate routes with the identical path attributes should be discarded. Should be enabled only when peering with an IBGP Route Server.

wfBgpPeerRSMode.name: wfBgpPeerRSMode
wfBgpPeerRSMode.description: Indicates the Route Reflector / Route Server Mode of BGP peer: (1) - not a Route Server or Route Reflector connection; (2) - peer is a Route Server client; (3) - peer is a Route Server in the same RS cluster; (4) - peer is a Route Server in a different RS cluster; (5) - peer is a Route Reflector client; (6) - peer is a Route Reflector in the same RR cluster; (7) - peer is a Route Reflector in a different RR cluster.

wfBgpPeerRSIdentifier.name: wfBgpPeerRSIdentifier
wfBgpPeerRSIdentifier.description: if wfBgpPeerRSMode is BGP_PEER_RS_MODE_INTERNAL or BGP_PEER_RS_MODE_RS_EXTERNAL, specifies the RS Identifier that is send in IDENTIFICATION message.

wfBgpPeerCfgDelayGranularity.name: wfBgpPeerCfgDelayGranularity
wfBgpPeerCfgDelayGranularity.description: the configured delay granularity in seconds.

wfBgpPeerLastErrorSrc.name: wfBgpPeerLastErrorSrc
wfBgpPeerLastErrorSrc.description: The source of the last error notification received/sent \ ( 1 = recv / 2 = sent ). A null is present if no errors \ have occured.

wfBgpPeerNexthopSelf.name: wfBgpPeerNexthopSelf
wfBgpPeerNexthopSelf.description: Disable the use of third party advertisements

wfBgpPeerASLoopDetect.name: wfBgpPeerASLoopDetect
wfBgpPeerASLoopDetect.description: Designates whether the router will kill a peering \ session if a Loop is detected in the AS Path.

wfBgpPeerBgpEcmpMethod.name: wfBgpPeerBgpEcmpMethod
wfBgpPeerBgpEcmpMethod.description: Defines a method to use IGP ECMP routing information. route-balance method distributes a set of destination networks that share the same BGP Next Hop among available ECMP routes. Each BGP network has one route submitted to IP RTM. traffic-balance uses all avaiable IGP ECMP routes. Each BGP network submitted to IP RTM number of times equal to number IGP ECMP routes to BGP Next Hop. This parameter is similar to wfBgpIbgpEcmpMethod but is applicable only to EBGP peer connections. IBGP peer connection selects ECMP method according to wfBgpIbgpEcmpMethod value.

wfBgpPeerDampenedRoutes.name: wfBgpPeerDampenedRoutes
wfBgpPeerDampenedRoutes.description: Number of routes from this peer that are suppressed due to flap dampening.

wfBgpPeerTTL.name: wfBgpPeerTTL
wfBgpPeerTTL.description: Configurable Time-To-Live field to be used for this peer connection. Unless wfBgpEbgpDebugSwitch is set, a TTL of 1 is used for external BGP connections. A value of zero (default) indicate to use wfIpBaseDefaultTTL as the TTL value for this peer connection.

wfBgpPeerTcpAuthentication.name: wfBgpPeerTcpAuthentication
wfBgpPeerTcpAuthentication.description: Indicates if BGP TCP Authentication is enabled\ none(1) - no authentication\ md5(2) - MD5 authentication enabled

wfBgpPeerTcpMd5KeyStorage.name: wfBgpPeerTcpMd5KeyStorage
wfBgpPeerTcpMd5KeyStorage.description: Indicates how the wfBgpPeerTcpMd5Key is stored \ in the MIB and configuration file. \ clear-text(1) - the key is stored unencrypted \ encrypted(2) - the key is stored encrypted

wfBgpPeerTcpMd5Key.name: wfBgpPeerTcpMd5Key
wfBgpPeerTcpMd5Key.description: if nil, no key configured\ if not nil, BGP TCP MD5 authentication key stored in \ wfBgpPeerTcpMd5KeyStorage format

wfBgpVirtualPeerTable.name: wfBgpVirtualPeerTable
wfBgpVirtualPeerTable.description: The BGP Virtual Peer table contains configuration and statistical information regarding this router's Virtual peers learned via the Route Server

wfBgpVirtualPeerEntry.name: wfBgpVirtualPeerEntry
wfBgpVirtualPeerEntry.description: An entry in the BGP-Virtual-Peer table

wfBgpVirtualPeerIdentifier.name: wfBgpVirtualPeerIdentifier
wfBgpVirtualPeerIdentifier.description: the BGP ID of the Peer

wfBgpVirtualPeerInUpdates.name: wfBgpVirtualPeerInUpdates
wfBgpVirtualPeerInUpdates.description: the number of BGP UPDATE messages received on this connection. This object should be initialized to zero when the connection is established.

wfBgpVirtualPeerTotalRoutes.name: wfBgpVirtualPeerTotalRoutes
wfBgpVirtualPeerTotalRoutes.description: the total number of routes that were received from this peer that we are currently maintaining.

wfBgpVirtualPeerInUpdateElapsedTime.name: wfBgpVirtualPeerInUpdateElapsedTime
wfBgpVirtualPeerInUpdateElapsedTime.description: Elapsed time in seconds since the last BGP UPDATE message was received from the peer. Each time wfBgpVirtualPeerInUpdates is incremented, the value of this object is set to zero (0).

wfBgpAsWeightTable.name: wfBgpAsWeightTable
wfBgpAsWeightTable.description: The BGP AS weight table contains weights for autonomous systems for use in best-route calculations

wfBgpAsWeightEntry.name: wfBgpAsWeightEntry
wfBgpAsWeightEntry.description: An entry in the BGP AS weight table

wfBgpAsWeightDelete.name: wfBgpAsWeightDelete
wfBgpAsWeightDelete.description: Create/Delete: if set to delete, the AS entry is removed from this table

wfBgpAsWeightDisable.name: wfBgpAsWeightDisable
wfBgpAsWeightDisable.description: Enable/Disable: controls whether the AS entry is enabled or disabled

wfBgpAsWeightState.name: wfBgpAsWeightState
wfBgpAsWeightState.description: the state of this AS weight entry

wfBgpAsWeightValue.name: wfBgpAsWeightValue
wfBgpAsWeightValue.description: the class-1 value to assign to this AS

wfBgpAsWeightValue2.name: wfBgpAsWeightValue2
wfBgpAsWeightValue2.description: the class-2 value to assign to this AS

wfBgpAsWeightValue3.name: wfBgpAsWeightValue3
wfBgpAsWeightValue3.description: the class-3 value to assign to this AS

wfBgpAsWeightValue4.name: wfBgpAsWeightValue4
wfBgpAsWeightValue4.description: the class-4 value to assign to this AS

wfBgpAsWeightValue5.name: wfBgpAsWeightValue5
wfBgpAsWeightValue5.description: the class-5 value to assign to this AS

wfBgpAsWeightValue6.name: wfBgpAsWeightValue6
wfBgpAsWeightValue6.description: the class-6 value to assign to this AS

wfBgpAsWeightValue7.name: wfBgpAsWeightValue7
wfBgpAsWeightValue7.description: the class-7 value to assign to this AS

wfBgpAsWeightValue8.name: wfBgpAsWeightValue8
wfBgpAsWeightValue8.description: the class-8 value to assign to this AS

wfBgp3PathAttrTable.name: wfBgp3PathAttrTable
wfBgp3PathAttrTable.description: The BGP3 received path attribute table contains information about paths to destination networks received by all peers. This table is deprecated and replaced with wfBgpPathAttrTable

wfBgp3PathAttrEntry.name: wfBgp3PathAttrEntry
wfBgp3PathAttrEntry.description: An entry in the BGP-3 Path Attribute Table

wfBgp3PathAttrPeer.name: wfBgp3PathAttrPeer
wfBgp3PathAttrPeer.description: the BGP identifier of the peer where the path information was learned.

wfBgp3PathAttrDestNetwork.name: wfBgp3PathAttrDestNetwork
wfBgp3PathAttrDestNetwork.description: the address of the destination network.

wfBgp3PathAttrOrigin.name: wfBgp3PathAttrOrigin
wfBgp3PathAttrOrigin.description: the ultimate origin of the path information: igp (1) -- network is interior; egp (2) -- network learned via EGP; incomplete (3) -- undetermined.

wfBgp3PathAttrASPath.name: wfBgp3PathAttrASPath
wfBgp3PathAttrASPath.description: the set of ASes that must be traversed to reach the network. Each AS is represented as a pair of octets according to the following algorithm: first-byte-of-pair = ASNumber / 256; second-byte-of-pair = ASNumber & 255;

wfBgp3PathAttrNextHop.name: wfBgp3PathAttrNextHop
wfBgp3PathAttrNextHop.description: the address of the border router that should be used as the next-hop for the destination network.

wfBgp3PathAttrInterASMetric.name: wfBgp3PathAttrInterASMetric
wfBgp3PathAttrInterASMetric.description: the optional inter-AS metric. if this attribute has not been provided for this route, the value for this object is 0.

wfBgp3PathAttrBgpPreference.name: wfBgp3PathAttrBgpPreference
wfBgp3PathAttrBgpPreference.description: the preference that is used to calculate this route with other BGP routes to the same destination

wfBgp3PathAttrBest.name: wfBgp3PathAttrBest
wfBgp3PathAttrBest.description: an indication of whether or not this was chosen as the best route to the destination

wfBgpPathAttrTable.name: wfBgpPathAttrTable
wfBgpPathAttrTable.description: The BGP received path attribute table contains information about paths to destination networks received by all peers.

wfBgpPathAttrEntry.name: wfBgpPathAttrEntry
wfBgpPathAttrEntry.description: An entry in the BGP Path Attribute Table

wfBgpPathAttrIpAddrPrefix.name: wfBgpPathAttrIpAddrPrefix
wfBgpPathAttrIpAddrPrefix.description: the IP address of the destination (sub)network.

wfBgpPathAttrIpAddrPrefixLen.name: wfBgpPathAttrIpAddrPrefixLen
wfBgpPathAttrIpAddrPrefixLen.description: Length in bits of the IP address prefix in the destination (sub)network address.

wfBgpPathAttrPeer.name: wfBgpPathAttrPeer
wfBgpPathAttrPeer.description: the IP address of the peer where the path information was learned.

wfBgpPathAttrOrigin.name: wfBgpPathAttrOrigin
wfBgpPathAttrOrigin.description: the ultimate origin of the path information: igp (1) -- network is interior; egp (2) -- network learned via EGP; incomplete (3) -- undetermined.

wfBgpPathAttrASPathSegment.name: wfBgpPathAttrASPathSegment
wfBgpPathAttrASPathSegment.description: The sequence of AS path segments. Each AS path segment is represented by a triple <type, length, value>. The type is a 1-octet field which has two possible values: 1 AS_SET: unordered set of ASs a route in the UPDATE message has traversed 2 AS_SEQUENCE: ordered set of ASs a route in the UPDATE message has traversed. The length is a 1-octet field containing the number of ASs in the value field. The value field contains one or more AS numbers, each AS is represented in the octet string as a pair of octets according to the following algorithm: first-byte-of-pair = ASNumber / 256; second-byte-of-pair = ASNumber & 255;

wfBgpPathAttrNextHop.name: wfBgpPathAttrNextHop
wfBgpPathAttrNextHop.description: the address of the border router that should be used as the next-hop for the destination network.

wfBgpPathAttrMultiExitDisc.name: wfBgpPathAttrMultiExitDisc
wfBgpPathAttrMultiExitDisc.description: The optional inter-AS metric. If this attribute has not been provided for this route, the value for this object is -1.

wfBgpPathAttrLocalPref.name: wfBgpPathAttrLocalPref
wfBgpPathAttrLocalPref.description: the originating BGP speaker's degree of preference for advertised route (-1..2147483647); if this attribute has not been provided for this route, the value for this object is -1.

wfBgpPathAttrAtomicAggregate.name: wfBgpPathAttrAtomicAggregate
wfBgpPathAttrAtomicAggregate.description: indicates whether or not the local system has selected a less specific route without selecting a more specific route

wfBgpPathAttrAggregatorAS.name: wfBgpPathAttrAggregatorAS
wfBgpPathAttrAggregatorAS.description: The AS number of the last BGP speaker that performed route aggregation. A value of zero (0) indicates the absence of this attribute.

wfBgpPathAttrAggregatorAddr.name: wfBgpPathAttrAggregatorAddr
wfBgpPathAttrAggregatorAddr.description: The BGP ID of the last BGP speaker that performed route aggregation. A value of 0.0.0.0 indicates the absence of this attribute.

wfBgpPathAttrCalcLocalPref.name: wfBgpPathAttrCalcLocalPref
wfBgpPathAttrCalcLocalPref.description: The degree of preference calculated by the receiving BGP speaker for an advertised route (-1..2147483647). A value of -1 indicates the absence of this attribute

wfBgpPathAttrBest.name: wfBgpPathAttrBest
wfBgpPathAttrBest.description: an indication of whether or not this was chosen as the best bgp rout to the destination and whether or not it was chosen as a forwarding IP route

wfBgpPathAttrUnknown.name: wfBgpPathAttrUnknown
wfBgpPathAttrUnknown.description: One or more path attributes not understood by this BGP speaker. Size zero (0) indicates the absence of such attribute(s). Octets beyond the maximum size (255), if any, are not recorded by this object.

wfBgpPathAttrImporterID.name: wfBgpPathAttrImporterID
wfBgpPathAttrImporterID.description: For RS, the BGP ID of the border router that imported this route

wfBgpPathAttrClusterID.name: wfBgpPathAttrClusterID
wfBgpPathAttrClusterID.description: For RS, the sequence of Cluter IDs of the Clusters. Size zero (0) indicates the absence of such attribute(s).

wfBgpPathAttrCommunity.name: wfBgpPathAttrCommunity
wfBgpPathAttrCommunity.description: List of BGP communities. Each community is 4 bytes long. Size zero (0) indicates the absence of community attribute. Octets beyond the maximum size (255), if any, are not recorded by this object.

wfBgpPathAttrCalcMED.name: wfBgpPathAttrCalcMED
wfBgpPathAttrCalcMED.description: The Multi Exit Disc. calculated by the receiving BGP speaker for an advertised route (-1...2G)

wfBgpDbgTable.name: wfBgpDbgTable
wfBgpDbgTable.description: BGP debug table contains objects that controls generation of BGP debug information

wfBgpDbgLocAddr.name: wfBgpDbgLocAddr
wfBgpDbgLocAddr.description: The peer's local address. If 0.0.0.0, debug attributes are applied to all peers to specified Remote Address or with specified BGP version

wfBgpDbgRemoteAddr.name: wfBgpDbgRemoteAddr
wfBgpDbgRemoteAddr.description: The peer's Remote Address . If 0.0.0.0, debug attrubutes are applied to all configured peers from specified Local Address; if 255.255.255.255, debug attrubutes are applied to BGP4 gate only.

wfBgpDbgMsgLevel.name: wfBgpDbgMsgLevel
wfBgpDbgMsgLevel.description: BGP log messages level. To control certain level of log messages BGP_DBG_MSG_ALL 0x001f0000 - 2031616 BGP_DBG_MSG_DEBUG 0x00010000 - 65536 BGP_DBG_MSG_INFO 0x00020000 - 131072 BGP_DBG_MSG_WARNING 0x00040000 - 262144 BGP_DBG_MSG_FAULT 0x00080000 - 524288 BGP_DBG_MSG_TRACE 0x00100000 - 1048576

wfBgpDbgMsgTraceSwitch.name: wfBgpDbgMsgTraceSwitch
wfBgpDbgMsgTraceSwitch.description: controls whether BGP messages that are exchanged on this connection are dumped to the log. BGP_DBG_MSG_DUMP_REC_OPEN enables tracing of OPEN messages BGP_DBG_MSG_DUMP_REC_UPDATE - UPDATE messages BGP_DBG_MSG_DUMP_REC_NOTIFICATION - NOTIFICATION and BGP_DBG_MSG_DUMP_REC_KEEPALIVE - KEEPALIVE on logical OR basis BGP_DBG_MSG_DUMP_DISABLED 1 BGP_DBG_MSG_DUMP_REC_OPEN 0x10 - 16 BGP_DBG_MSG_DUMP_REC_UPDATE 0x20 - 32 BGP_DBG_MSG_DUMP_REC_NOTIFICATION 0x40 - 64 BGP_DBG_MSG_DUMP_REC_KEEPALIVE 0x80 - 128

wfBgpDbgLogCode.name: wfBgpDbgLogCode
wfBgpDbgLogCode.description: Indicates that a debug log message which corresponds to the value of this attributes should be or should be not sent to the log. Affects wfBgpDbgCodes only. In order to save combined list of messages you have to set wfBgpDbgBootCodes directly as copy of wfBgpDbgCodes

wfBgpDbgLogCodeDisable.name: wfBgpDbgLogCodeDisable
wfBgpDbgLogCodeDisable.description: Indicates that a debug log message defined in wfBgpDbgCode will be or will be not logged

wfBgpDbgCodes.name: wfBgpDbgCodes
wfBgpDbgCodes.description: Vector of enabled debug messages (to check only). Messages are identified via the string of bits contained within this attribute. The first octet contains bits 0 to 7, the second octet contains bits 8 to 15, and so on, with the most significant bit referring to the lowest bit number in the octet (e.g., the MSB of the first octet refers to bit 0). If a bit, i, is present and set, then the DEBUG log message with the code (i) is enabled.

wfBgpDbgBootCodes.name: wfBgpDbgBootCodes
wfBgpDbgBootCodes.description: User-defined vector of enabled debug messages at boot moment. Coded as instance above

wfBgpPathAttributeTable.name: wfBgpPathAttributeTable
wfBgpPathAttributeTable.description: The BGP received path attribute table contains information about paths to destination networks received by all peers.

wfBgpPathAttributeEntry.name: wfBgpPathAttributeEntry
wfBgpPathAttributeEntry.description: An entry in the BGP Path Attribute Table

wfBgpPathAttributeIpAddrPrefix.name: wfBgpPathAttributeIpAddrPrefix
wfBgpPathAttributeIpAddrPrefix.description: the IP address of the destination (sub)network.

wfBgpPathAttributeIpAddrPrefixLen.name: wfBgpPathAttributeIpAddrPrefixLen
wfBgpPathAttributeIpAddrPrefixLen.description: Length in bits of the IP address prefix in the destination (sub)network address.

wfBgpPathAttributeImporterID.name: wfBgpPathAttributeImporterID
wfBgpPathAttributeImporterID.description: For RS, the BGP ID of the border router that imported this route

wfBgpPathAttributePeer.name: wfBgpPathAttributePeer
wfBgpPathAttributePeer.description: the IP address of the peer where the path information was learned.

wfBgpPathAttributeOrigin.name: wfBgpPathAttributeOrigin
wfBgpPathAttributeOrigin.description: the ultimate origin of the path information: igp (1) -- network is interior; egp (2) -- network learned via EGP; incomplete (3) -- undetermined.

wfBgpPathAttributeASPathSegment.name: wfBgpPathAttributeASPathSegment
wfBgpPathAttributeASPathSegment.description: The sequence of AS path segments. Each AS path segment is represented by a triple <type, length, value>. The type is a 1-octet field which has two possible values: 1 AS_SET: unordered set of ASs a route in the UPDATE message has traversed 2 AS_SEQUENCE: ordered set of ASs a route in the UPDATE message has traversed. The length is a 1-octet field containing the number of ASs in the value field. The value field contains one or more AS numbers, each AS is represented in the octet string as a pair of octets according to the following algorithm: first-byte-of-pair = ASNumber / 256; second-byte-of-pair = ASNumber & 255;

wfBgpPathAttributeNextHop.name: wfBgpPathAttributeNextHop
wfBgpPathAttributeNextHop.description: the address of the border router that should be used as the next-hop for the destination network.

wfBgpPathAttributeMultiExitDisc.name: wfBgpPathAttributeMultiExitDisc
wfBgpPathAttributeMultiExitDisc.description: The optional inter-AS metric. If this attribute has not been provided for this route, the value for this object is -1.

wfBgpPathAttributeLocalPref.name: wfBgpPathAttributeLocalPref
wfBgpPathAttributeLocalPref.description: the originating BGP speaker's degree of preference for advertised route (-1..2147483647); if this attribute has not been provided for this route, the value for this object is -1.

wfBgpPathAttributeAtomicAggregate.name: wfBgpPathAttributeAtomicAggregate
wfBgpPathAttributeAtomicAggregate.description: indicates whether or not the local system has selected a less specific route without selecting a more specific route

wfBgpPathAttributeAggregatorAS.name: wfBgpPathAttributeAggregatorAS
wfBgpPathAttributeAggregatorAS.description: The AS number of the last BGP speaker that performed route aggregation. A value of zero (0) indicates the absence of this attribute.

wfBgpPathAttributeAggregatorAddr.name: wfBgpPathAttributeAggregatorAddr
wfBgpPathAttributeAggregatorAddr.description: The BGP ID of the last BGP speaker that performed route aggregation. A value of 0.0.0.0 indicates the absence of this attribute.

wfBgpPathAttributeCalcLocalPref.name: wfBgpPathAttributeCalcLocalPref
wfBgpPathAttributeCalcLocalPref.description: The degree of preference calculated by the receiving BGP speaker for an advertised route (-1..2147483647). A value of -1 indicates the absence of this attribute

wfBgpPathAttributeBest.name: wfBgpPathAttributeBest
wfBgpPathAttributeBest.description: an indication of whether or not this was chosen as the best bgp rout to the destination and whether or not it was chosen as a forwarding IP route

wfBgpPathAttributeUnknown.name: wfBgpPathAttributeUnknown
wfBgpPathAttributeUnknown.description: One or more path attributes not understood by this BGP speaker. Size zero (0) indicates the absence of such attribute(s). Octets beyond the maximum size (255), if any, are not recorded by this object.

wfBgpPathAttributeClusterID.name: wfBgpPathAttributeClusterID
wfBgpPathAttributeClusterID.description: For RS, the sequence of Cluter IDs of the Clusters. Size zero (0) indicates the absence of such attribute(s).

wfBgpPathAttributeCommunity.name: wfBgpPathAttributeCommunity
wfBgpPathAttributeCommunity.description: List of BGP communities. Each community is 4 bytes long. Size zero (0) indicates the absence of community attribute. Octets beyond the maximum size (255), if any, are not recorded by this object.

wfBgpPathAttributeCalcMED.name: wfBgpPathAttributeCalcMED
wfBgpPathAttributeCalcMED.description: The Multi Exit Disc. calculated by the receiving BGP speaker for an advertised route (-1...2G)

wfBgpPathAttributeFlapPenalty.name: wfBgpPathAttributeFlapPenalty
wfBgpPathAttributeFlapPenalty.description: Penalty value based on number of route flaps

wfBgpPathAttributeFlapCount.name: wfBgpPathAttributeFlapCount
wfBgpPathAttributeFlapCount.description: Number of times a route flapped since the last time the penaltywas reset to zero

wfBgpPathAttributeRouteDampened.name: wfBgpPathAttributeRouteDampened
wfBgpPathAttributeRouteDampened.description: Shows whether this route is currently suppressed from being announced

wfBgpRouteFlapDampeningEntry.name: wfBgpRouteFlapDampeningEntry
wfBgpRouteFlapDampeningEntry.description: An entry in the Route Flap Dampening table

wfBgpRouteFlapDampeningDelete.name: wfBgpRouteFlapDampeningDelete
wfBgpRouteFlapDampeningDelete.description: Create/Delete: if set to delete, the entry is removed

wfBgpRouteFlapDampeningIndex.name: wfBgpRouteFlapDampeningIndex
wfBgpRouteFlapDampeningIndex.description: Index number of this entry in wfBgpRouteFlapDampeningTable

wfBgpRouteFlapDampeningCutoffThreshold.name: wfBgpRouteFlapDampeningCutoffThreshold
wfBgpRouteFlapDampeningCutoffThreshold.description: Value of penalty over which a route is suppressed. Expressed in number of withdrawals

wfBgpRouteFlapDampeningReuseThreshold.name: wfBgpRouteFlapDampeningReuseThreshold
wfBgpRouteFlapDampeningReuseThreshold.description: Value of penalty below which a route is unsuppressed. Expressed in number of withdrawals

wfBgpRouteFlapDampeningReachableDecay.name: wfBgpRouteFlapDampeningReachableDecay
wfBgpRouteFlapDampeningReachableDecay.description: Duration in minutes after which the penalty value is reduced to half when the route is reachable. Default is 5 minutes

wfBgpRouteFlapDampeningUnreachableDecay.name: wfBgpRouteFlapDampeningUnreachableDecay
wfBgpRouteFlapDampeningUnreachableDecay.description: Duration in minutes after which the penalty value is reduced to half when the route is unreachable. Default is 15 minutes.

wfBgpRouteFlapDampeningMaxHoldDown.name: wfBgpRouteFlapDampeningMaxHoldDown
wfBgpRouteFlapDampeningMaxHoldDown.description: Maximum time a route remains suppressed. Expressed in number seconds. Default is 45 minutes

wfBgpRouteFlapDampeningMemoryLimit.name: wfBgpRouteFlapDampeningMemoryLimit
wfBgpRouteFlapDampeningMemoryLimit.description: If the state of a route(reachable/unreachable) remains stable for this duration, the penalty is cleared and the route unsuppressed. Expressed in number of minutes. Default is 45 minutes

comments: Produced by pysmi-0.3.4 at Fri May 24 22:33:57 2019
